DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Recurrent Or Progressive Disease Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the status was considered a disease relapse or progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Recurrent Or Progressive Disease Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The return of a disease after a period of remission._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElement.changeDescription: . Removed CSI for 2022. AK 6/18/12. 8/3/12mn-added cs 2022, alt name exists. 8/24/12mn-added alt name & cs for 2122. 9/19/12mn-removed alt names aml_post_fish_eval_rlp_yn & aml_post_cnv_cyto_rlp_yn. using CDE 3076157. 9/20/12mn-removed alt name; aml_post_mole_eval_rlp_yn. 10/9/12mn-added alt name for 2111 all_post_rlps_mole_rlp_yn. 10/9/12mn-deleted extra alt names with extra spaces. removed alt names all_post_lrpt_mole_rlp_yn, all_post_lrpt_fish_rlp_yn, all_post_lrpt_conv_rlp_yn for 2111. ASQT added for 2018. AK 2/24/14. 4/28/14mn-added alt name for 2018r3. Added human readable def. System generated def displayed as alt def. No version needed. AK 11/6/14 Added alt name for 2115r3. AK 4/8/16 Added alt names for 2x19r3. AK 4/11/16 5/11/2016wz: added AQT for 4100r1 Alt  name "tc_base_dx_sts_othr_spec" removed due to being used on CDE 61294. AK 6/30/16 Alt name "mds"removed due to being used on CDE 4191271. AK 7/8/16  Added AQT for 2118r4 2017-08-21 SLS.;Added HCT_BRIDG5 alternate name - RR 2018-12-23
